intro: Xylopia toussaintii, commonly known as the African star anise, is a tropical evergreen tree native to western Africa. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, fragrant leaves and flowers. The plant produces small, clustered white flowers that are followed by dark, star-shaped berries. Its bark and leaves have been used traditionally for their medicinal properties, including antispasmodic and digestive effects. Xylopia toussaintii thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests.
